name: Dextrose Monohydrate
desc: Dextrose Monohydrate (d-glucose) is a simple sugar, obtained in industrial conditions from starch by acid or enzyme hydrolysis. Dextrose Monohydrate is a white powder of crystalline structure without any odor.
techs: Dextrose Monohydrate is popular in a number of food production segments as it enhances the aroma and flavor as well as a cooling sensation. In fermentation goods, Dextrose Monohydrate is used as a source of carbon and a carrier. In the meat industry, Dextrose Monohydrate allows for enhanced diffusion of salt and nitrate in processed meat.
shelf: The shelf life of Dextrose Monohydrate is 24 months. The product has to be stored in a dry, cool, and well-ventilated warehouse.
packaging: Foodcom supplies its Business Partners with Dextrose Monohydrate in 25 kg bags.
applications: In food production, Dextrose Monohydrate is widely used as a sweetener and a core ingredient of corn syrup. In confectionery, Dextrose Monohydrate is found in jams, marmalade, and jelly as well as ice-cream, cookies, and other baked goods.
